The plant is native to tropical and subtropical regions, including parts of Southeast Asia, Africa, and the Pacific Islands. Diplazium induratum thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forests or along stream banks. Its spores are produced on the underside of its fronds, contributing to its reproductive strategy in humid climates.
